body: @tcNickolas yes, it looks like an issue during the shutdown. Let's merge the logging changes (because I need them for debugging) and I will investigate.
@motus I've merged logging changes, and filed https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1729 for the Travis timeout issue, since we're seeing more of them.
I completed a pass.
I've addressed the comment and updated the PR. Apache AppVeyor seems to be stuck again, a good build is at my branch: https://ci.appveyor.com/project/tcNickolas/reef/build/486-REEF-1438
LGTM. I will merge it.
@motus Could this `RejectedExecutionException` error have similar root cause to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1661 ?

@tcNickolas yes, it is all about the shutdown. `RejectedExecutionException` happens when we close the thread pool that still has some tasks scheduled. It may or may not be an error - it really depends on the context. Still, the cause for this error is definitely similar to the one in [REEF-1661](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1661).
I'll close that PR for now while I am doing the investigation. I'll reopen it later when I have more information and/or the problem is fixed
I completed a pass.
LGTM, will test and merge.
LGTM. I will test and merge.

This is actually the only place where these exceptions are logged :-) This log was added in the infamous REEF-1251 specifically to debug this kind of failures, because these exceptions are not caught anywhere else. Ideally we need to figure out the exceptions handling when spawning a new thread (a bit similar to REEF-1202), but not in this change.
That's right. We logged at those places and the re-throw cannot be caught from the main thread. The issue was mitigated by using cancellation token #1052 .
I will merge if there is no more comment.
AppVeyor build failed. Not sure why. My local build is successful.

It's not able to find commit to checkout. I think this happens when some other pull request gets merged to master between this one is submitted (and commit hash for this change + master is calculated) and AppVeyor actually gets to building it (and master has changed so hash is different now).

You can check AppVeyor on my branch which succeeded: https://ci.appveyor.com/project/tcNickolas/reef/build/490-REEF-1730
@jwang98052 thanks for reviewing! I've submitted my fixes. (still not 100% convinced about common configuration modules, though)
It's OK to me as I sometimes, I also feel each class contains its own logic is easy to read.
Do you have test case for submitting?
@jwang98052 yes, my next PR will have a HelloREEF example that runs in Unmanaged AM mode.
LGTM. I will test and merge.
The client sometimes gets stuck in the `SUBMITTED` mode - I am temporarily closing this PR for investigation.
@tcNickolas I have addressed your review comments.

I think the new version of the change breaks something; AppVeyor build hasn't completed yet, but `TestIsMasterCompleted` fails both in AppVeyor and locally. Maybe our test tasks don't send proper message? Please double-check
@tcNickolas I have fixed the unit test and AppVeyor passed.
LGTM, passes tests in AppVeyor, I'll merge

We've decided to take an alternate approach to IMRU metrics collection system, per https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1732. This pull request still needs work before it can be merged, and none of us would be able to take it over. @dkm2110 , if you don't plan to work on this anymore, could you please close this pull request? Since none of us are admins of this repo, only the owner can close it :-)
This change will break existing IMRU implementations in codebases outside of REEF itself, right? If it will, we should probably mark it as breaking change in JIRA.

The issue mentioned above is caused by a bug in Hadoop [YARN-4452](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/YARN-4452). We have a unit test to verify that condition, and the code is already in master (see [REEF-1710](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1710) and PR #1224). Reopening.

@tcNickolas That is  good point. I would create a separate interface for getting task progress and have a default  implementation. That would make sure we don't break anyone. Currently, update tasks can implement this interface. In future, if others what to implement it, it is also fine. 
The PR has been updated for the change.

How does this interact with the overall metrics system? For instance, I have some conerns about using `string` as the type of task progress here as we won't be able to aggregate it from 1000s of nodes.

@markusweimer I think for IMRU specifically it is not practical to aggregate information from each mapper evaluator, since job progress is pretty much maintained by update evaluator. If some app-specific information is really necessary to aggregate, mappers could send it to update evaluator and it would aggregate it. This simplifies design of update-driver metrics communication

**NOTE:** CI builds currently fail because #1248 has to be merged before this one. Please try it *after* merging #1248  - using Hadoop 2.7.3+ (it hangs on Hadoop 2.7.1 that we have on CISL cluster due to the `NullPointerException` in YARN - see [YARN-4452](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/YARN-4452))
Based on the discussion with @markusweimer and @tcNickolas , I am closing the is PR for now. New implementation will come out.

@jwang98052 After the offline discussion we had on Friday, is this PR still valid? I think we converged on a different implementation which would not be IMRU-specific, so it would need to take a different route
LGTM, will test and merge
Will do. We kind of have it in [REEF-1710](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1710) (PR #1224), but I'll add a REEF-based test here, too
Based on the discussion with @markusweimer and @tcNickolas , I am closing the is PR for now. New implementation will come out.
Do you have instruction for how to run it on YARN?
Do you have local RunTime version for it?
Since #1248 has been merged, you might want to trigger another Travis CI.

@jwang98052 Unmanaged AM mode is YARN-specific - this is why we have a dedicated runtime configuration for it. For the local runtime, though, we already have some unit tests, e.g. `REEFEnvironmentDriverTest` that runs the driver in the client process.
We don't plan to use `Metrics` project? It might get confusing to have counters there and counters here but completely different kinds of counters...

We are thinking to have metrics at REEF level but as a folder in REEF common instead of a separate project. The old Metrics should be removed eventually. The counters defined in TeleMetry  folder should be unique and used by IMRU in future.
@tcNickolas I have addressed your review comments. Thanks!

There is one test failure from Trvis-CI
Failed tests: 
  RemoteTest.testRemoteTest:180 testRemoteTest takes too long and times out : 0 out of 6 events

but I don't think it is related. I will run entire test locally again before the merge.
@jwang98052 this is a Wake test failing on a timeout. Given the load of our CI environment, the problem can be simply in the performance of the test server.

Welcome to your first code review on REEF :) 

I left some detailed comments in the code review above. One thing which GitHub doesn't allow a review off is the commit message. We follow a [very particular style](https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/REEF/Commit+Messages) for them. This allows for pretty easy to parse output of `git log --oneline`:

```
e554dd3 [REEF-1716] Implement HelloREEF example for YARN Unmanaged AM mode
944ef73 [REEF-1731] Implement JobSubmitted client-side event and a corresponding handler
3c7aba2 [REEF-1725] Set job done as task result if UpdateTask is done in IMRU
```

For this PR, we'll fix it as part of the merge process.

@skanjila, there is no need to put the commit ID into the PR name :) The `git log` output I showed contained it because that's how git log formats the commit messages, not because we keep them in the commit header.
@markusweimer Can you review/merge it?
Will do a pass now.
LGTM, will merge.
I will close this PR in the next commit. @dkm2110 feel free to reopen.

Fair enough. I was thinking of us breaking it. But we have more elaborate tests in the code base for that. Will merge.
I have completed a pass. Please update and push the change to your branch again.
I agree with @jwang98052 , if the lack of backslash in the `SolutionDir` variable is not breaking, we shouldn't change it. This will also keep the change much smaller (just 2 files I think?)
@markusweimer I have addressed your review comments.
@Emeka-NMC As it will involve more changes in build.prop and other scripts, let us be very careful to make this change. For now, may be just close this PR.

Commit message needs to follow the format as given on the wiki.

[REEF-JIRA_ISSUE_NUMBER] THE_TITLE_OF_THE_JIRA
 
This addressed the issue by 
  * INSERT_DESCRIPTION_OF_SOMETHING
  * INSERT_DESCRIPTION_OF_SOMETHING_ELSE
  * ...
 
JIRA:
  [REEF-JIRA_ISSUE_NUMBER](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-JIRA_ISSUE_NUMBER)
Closing pull request as I will reopen another one following standard approach as outlined in contributing wiki

lgtm, will test and merge

@motus Thanks for the comment! I've fixed the code :)

This is a reasonable thing to try. I'm not 100% sure this is the root cause though, so we should keep an eye on future AppVeyor builds to make sure this failure doesn't reappear (like a lot of other failures did).
LGTM, will test and merge
LGTM, will test and merge
LGTM, will test and merge. However, appveyor tests still fail...

> Modified the test validation condition in the case task is completed before evaluator fails.

This makes the test non-deterministic, doesn't it?

That's true. Theoretically if the poison for sure happens, we should let task to sleep forever and never return until the evaluator is crashed by the poison, or increase the task sleep time just as a bottom line to end the task. 
A deterministic way usually is for task to wait and notify the task to complete after poison happens. In this case, the poison crash the evaluator, so it is not necessary. 
When we run locally, the poison always happens before task completes. But in appVeyor, one could be slower than another.

> When we run locally, the poison always happens before task completes. But in appVeyor, one could be slower than another.

Aren't both expressed in timers in seconds? That should be honored by both execution environments in the same way, right?
Yes, both are ms, but on different threads. After the specified time, the poison schedules an Alarm, then depends on how quick the alarm is triggered I guess.
@markusweimer Does it look better? Thanks for the feedback. It is very helpful.
Closing pull request as we've decided as a community to do the 451 upgrade
@taegeonum I forgot to add PR# to the commit message when I merged your changes into master. Could you please close that PR by hand? Thank you!

@shouhengyi-microsoft We need to close the `EvaluatorMessageDispatcher` when we shut down the `EvaluatorManager`. In the fix, I see a bunch of extra logging, but no actuall calls to close the message dispatcher. Am I missing something, or are you saying that we already close the dispatcher properly?
So @jwang98052 maybe you can merge it, too? :)
I will test and merge
In that case, maybe expand the timeout on the task (e.g. 2x the alarm time). That way, we can be more accommodating for slow machines without making this test non-deterministic.
LGTM. Will test and merge.
Looks good, and all tests pass on Linux and on Windows. Will test it on YARN and merge.
@markusweimer I made the  change to make task sleeping time longer.
